FuncDef:
The load-balance mpls unequal-cost enable command enables unequal cost multipath (UCMP) for MPLS P nodes (excluding BGP P nodes).
The undo load-balance mpls unequal-cost enable command disables UCMP for MPLS P nodes (excluding BGP P nodes).
By default, UCMP is not enabled for MPLS P nodes (excluding BGP P nodes).
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If UCMP s enabled and the MPLS P nodes (excluding BGP P nodes) have multiple outbound interfaces, UCMP is performed among the outbound interfaces based on bandwidth weights. If UCMP is disabled and the MPLS P nodes (excluding BGP P nodes) have multiple outbound interfaces, equal-cost multipath (ECMP) is performed among the outbound interfaces. To enable UCMP for MPLS P nodes (excluding BGP P nodes), run the load-balance mpls unequal-cost enable command.
Precautions
In CBTS/TE group scenarios, if some tunnels are not configured with a weight, flows with different priorities are forwarded on the associated tunnel through equal-cost routes.
If the CBTS/TE group is configured and this command is run simultaneously, the CBTS/TE group takes effect preferentially, and UCMP does not take effect.
